result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger Vang

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 22CF165, 22CF117, 22CF3, 21CF968, 21CF1112, 21CF1114, 21CF1197, 22CF61, 21TR8325 are called at 11:30 AM) Defendant Roger Vang in court, in custody.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Roger Vang.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defense recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defense requests that the State continue with testing on the blood in 21TR8325. Discussion held regarding procedure. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in 22CF165, 22CF117, 22CF3. Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF165 Count 1- Take and Drive Vehicle without Consent, 22CF117 Count 2- Felony Bail Jumping, 22CF3 Count 1- Possession of Methamphetamine, 21CF968 Count 1- Possession of Methamphetamine, 21TR8325- OWI 1st Offense. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including 21CF1112, 21CF1114, 21CF1197, 22CF61, 21TR7259, 21TR8272, 21TR8324, 21TR8326, 21TR8327, 22TR72. 
Court withholds sentence in 22CF165, 22CF117, 22CF3, 21CF968 and orders 2 years probation with the following conditions: 60 days jail with Huber on 21CF968 Count 1, all stayed pending further order of the court; No contact with K.S., S.V.; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; AODA and follow through with recommendations; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders 22CF165- 57 days credit, 22CF117- 3 days credit, 22CF3- 4 days credit, 21CF968- 1 day credit. 
21TR8325- Court orders $811.50 fine, Mayo Blood Draw Fee $, 6 months Driver's License revocation, and AODA and follow through with recommendations.

(Cases 21CF968, 21CF1112, 21CF1114, 21CF1197, 22CF3, 22CF61, 22CF117, 22CF165 are called at 2:38 PM) Defendant Roger Vang in court, in custody.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Roger Vang.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver 21CF968, 22CF165. Further scheduling with Branch 4 Judicial Assistant.
Plea hearing on April 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Cases called at 9:37 AM: 21CF968, 21CF1112, 21CF1114, 21CF1197, 22CF3, 22CF61, 22CF17, 22CF165.
Defendant Roger Vang appeared by video, in custody from the jail, Attorney George E. Miller for Roger Vang appeared in court, Attorney Monica A Fallon for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Attorney Miller requests Preliminary Hearing be scheduled.
21CF968: Preliminary Hearing: 3/22/22 at 2:00 PM with the other cases to ride along.

Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
